definition: lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
surname Niu
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: You are just casting pearls before swine.
If you didn't read it, I'm talking to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没看它，那我就成对牛弹琴了。

sentences.english: Your advice is chucked away on that boy.
sentences.chinese: 你的劝告对那个男孩来说是对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: She read them Shakespeare, but it was casting pearls before swine.
sentences.chinese: 她在他们面前读莎士比亚的著作，简直就是对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: You are casting pearls before swine。
The saying "to play the lute to a cow" implies a gibe at the audience.
sentences.chinese: “对牛弹琴”这句话，含有讥笑对象的意思。

sentences.english: He explained the beauty of the music to his wife but it was casting pearls before swine.
sentences.chinese: 他向她讲解那音乐的妙处，可是这无异于对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: Talking to him is like player the lute to a cow.
sentences.chinese: 跟他说话就象是对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: He explained the beauty of the music to her but it was casting pearls before swine.
sentences.chinese: 他跟他妻子讲解那音乐之美，可是这无异于对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: The saying 'to play the flute to a cow' inplies a gibe at the audience.
sentences.chinese: “对牛弹琴”这句话，含有讥笑对象的意思。

sentences.english: He is too proud to accept your suggestion, you are casting your pearls before swine.
sentences.chinese: 他太骄傲了，不会接受你的建议的，你只在对牛弹琴。
对他讲笑话是对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: Now I think I was just casting pearls before swine.
sentences.chinese: 现在我觉得我只是在对牛弹琴罢了。

definition: lit. chicken speaking with duck/fig. talking without communicating/people not understanding each other
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: lit. a donkey's lips do not match a horse's mouth (idiom)/fig. beside the point/incongruous
pinyin: lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to parrot/to repeat uncritically what sb says
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
when views are irreconcilable, it's a waste of breath to continue discussion (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 bu4 tou2 ji1 ban4 ju4 duo1

definition: to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
lit. to ask a blind man the way (idiom)/fig. to seek advice from an incompetent
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)
lit. to burn zithers and cook cranes/fig. to waste valuable resources/to destroy wantonly beautiful things
unable to understand/can't get the point
lit. to try to make an ox drink by forcing its head down to the water (idiom)/fig. to try to impose one's will on sb
pinyin: niu2 bu4 he1 shui3 qiang3 an4 tou2

definition: lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
incoherent (writing or speech)/nonsensical/a load of crap
to bring trouble on oneself
